com.dautelle.math
Class Matrix.LUDecomposition

java.lang.Object
  com.dautelle.realtime.RealtimeObject
      com.dautelle.math.Matrix.LUDecomposition
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, Realtime, java.io.Serializable
Enclosing class:
Matrix
public static final class Matrix.LUDecomposition
extends RealtimeObject

This class represents the decomposition of a Matrix into a product of lower and upper triangular matrices (L and U, respectively).

This decomposition is typically used to resolve linear systems of equations (Gaussian elimination) or to calculate the determinant of a square Matrix (O(nÂ³)).

Numerical stability is guaranteed (through pivoting) if the Operable elements of the Matrix source are derived from java.lang.Number.

Instances of this class are created by Matrix.lu().

Version:
5.3, December 10, 2003
Author:
Jean-Marie Dautelle
See Also:
Serialized Form

getLower

public Matrix getLower(Operable one,
                       Operable zero)
Returns the lower triangular matrix.

Parameters:
zero - the operable for zero.
Returns:
the lower triangular matrix of the LU decomposition.

                       Operable zero)
Returns the upper triangular matrix.

Parameters:
zero - the operable for zero.
Returns:

solve

public Matrix solve(Matrix B)
Returns the solution X of the equation: A * X = B with this = A.lu() using back and forward substitutions.

Parameters:
B - the input vector.
Returns:
the solution X = (1 / A) * B.
Throws:
MatrixDimensionException - if A.getRowDimension() != B.getRowDimension().

inverse

public Matrix inverse()
Returns the solution X of the equation: A * X = Identity with this = A.lu() using back and forward substitutions.

Returns:
this.solve(Identity)

determinant

public Operable determinant()
Returns the determinant of the Matrix having this Matrix.LUDecomposition.

Returns:
the determinant of the matrix source.
